details:
Case 138 is a 26 year-old male Singapore Citizen who has no recent travel history to affected countries and regions. He is warded in an isolation room at National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID). He is a close contact of Case 66 and family member of Cases 83 and 91, and is linked to the cluster at The Life Church and Missions Singapore.

As he had been identified as a close contact of previous confirmed cases, he had been quarantined from 15 February to 6 March. Subsequent test results confirmed COVID-19 infection on 6 March afternoon.

After his quarantine had ended, he had visited SAFRA Punggol (9 Sentul Crescent). He stays at Rivervale Drive.

He has fully recovered from the infection and have been discharged from hospital today (9 March).Â
